original: Holmgren, Per, stadsarkitekt, Växjö, f. 9/9/12 i Borlänge, Kopparb. L, av trafikch., major Sven Holmgren o. Elsa Jonson. G. 46 m. Doris Mea-cock. — Stud:ex. i Karlskrona 32, ar-kit:ex. v. KTH 38, stud:resor t. Danm., Tyskl. o. Tjeckoslov. 32, Belg. o. Frankr. 33, Norge 35, Finl. o. Engl. 316, Ital. 37. Anst. h. arkit. C. O. Hal|lström i Sthlm 38-39, v. Karlskrona örlogsvarv 40-44, bitr. stadsarkit. i Kristianstad 44, stadsarkit. i Varberg 45, i Växjö sed. 46. Medl. av SAR.
translated: Holmgren, Per, city architect of Växjö, born September 9, 1912 in Borlänge, Kopparberg County, son of traffic manager Major Sven Holmgren and Elsa Jonson. Married in 1946 to Doris Meacock. Holmgren graduated from Karlskrona high school in 1932, earned an architecture degree from KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) in 1938, and studied in Denmark, Germany, Czechoslovakia, Belgium, France, Norway, Finland, England, and Italy between 1932 to 1937. Employed as an architect with C. O. Hallström in Stockholm from 1938 to 1939, at Karlskrona naval shipyard from 1940 to 1944, and as deputy city architect in Kristianstad in 1944. Holmgren served as city architect in Varberg in 1945 before settling in Växjö in 1946. He is a member of the SAR (Swedish Association of Architects).
